krns_prophet module

The krns_prophet module contains…

The KRNSProphet class

class kronos.models.krns_prophet.KRNSProphet(modeler, interval_width: float = 0.95, growth: str = 'linear', daily_seasonality: bool = False, weekly_seasonality: bool = True, yearly_seasonality: bool = True, seasonality_mode: str = 'multiplicative', floor: Optional[int] = None, cap: Optional[int] = None, country_holidays: str = 'IT', model: Optional[prophet.forecaster.Prophet] = None)

Class to implement Prophet in kronos.

__init__(modeler, interval_width: float = 0.95, growth: str = 'linear', daily_seasonality: bool = False, weekly_seasonality: bool = True, yearly_seasonality: bool = True, seasonality_mode: str = 'multiplicative', floor: Optional[int] = None, cap: Optional[int] = None, country_holidays: str = 'IT', model: Optional[prophet.forecaster.Prophet] = None) → None

Initialization method.

Parameters

  • modeler (Modeler) – The Modeler instance used to interact with data.

  • interval_width (float) – Width of the uncertainty intervals provided for the forecast.

  • growth (str) – String ’linear’, ’logistic’, or ’flat’ to specify a linear, logistic or flat trend.

  • daily_seasonality (bool) – Fit daily seasonality.

  • weekly_seasonality (bool) – Fit weekly seasonality.

  • yearly_seasonality (bool) – Fit yearly seasonality.

  • seasonality_mode (str) – One among ‘additive’ (default) or ‘multiplicative’.

  • floor (int) – The saturating minimum of the time-series to forecast.

  • cap (int) – The saturating maximum of the time-series to forecast.

  • country_holidays (str) – Name of the country to add holidays for.

  • model (Prophet) – An already fitted Prophet model, to instantiate a kronos Prophet from an already fitted model.

Returns

No return.

Example

krns_model = KRNSProphet(
        modeler=modeler,
        interval_width=0.95,
        growth='logistic',
        daily_seasonality=False,
        weekly_seasonality=True,
        yearly_seasonality=True,
        seasonality_mode='multiplicative',
        floor=0,
        cap=9999999999999,
        country_holidays='IT',
        model=None,
    )
fit() → None
Fit the model:

  1. Instantiate the model class.

  2. Add floor/cap to train data.

  3. Add country holidays.

  4. Fit the model.

  5. Remove floor/cap columns from train data.

Returns

No return.

log_model(artifact_path: str) → None

Log the model artifact to mlflow.

Parameters

artifact_path (str) – Run-relative artifact path.

Returns

No return.

log_params(client: mlflow.tracking.client.MlflowClient, run_id: str) → None

Log the model params to mlflow.

Parameters

  • client (MlflowClient) – The mlflow client used to log parameters.

  • run_id (str) – The run id under which log parameters.

Returns

No return.

predict(n_days: int, fcst_first_date: datetime.date = datetime.date(2022, 6, 3)) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame
Parameters

  • n_days (int) – Number of data points to predict.

  • fcst_first_date (datetime.date) – First date of forecast.

Returns

(pd.DataFrame) Pandas DataFrame containing the predictions.

preprocess() → None

Get the dataframe into the condition to be processed by the model: renaming columns with date as ‘ds’ and with metric as ‘y’.

Returns

No return.
